Address.college_name: The University of the West Indies, Mona Campus

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1948; incorporated by Royal Charter 1962. The University is supported by and serves 15 different territories in the West Indies. An international institution recognized worldwide for its scholarship in Science, Medicine, Social Sciences, Agriculture and Humanities. The UWI campus in Mona, Jamaica serves as the headquarters of the University of the West Indies (UWI) system
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May (August-December; January-May). Also Summer School, June-July
AdmissionRequirements: Completion of secondary school education General Certificate of Education for most Faculties

Address.Street:
Norman Manley Highway
Palisadoes Park
P.O. Box 8051

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1980 as the Jamaica Maritime Training Institute (JMTI). Became Caribbean Maritime Institute (CMI) 1992. Acquired current status and title 2017

Address.college_name: College of Agriculture, Science and Education

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1981 as a replacement institution for the Jamaica School of Agriculture (JSA), founded 1942. Acquired current status and title 1995 following merger with Passley Gardens Teachers’ College (PGTC), also founded 1981

Address.college_name: Edna Manley College of the Visual and Performing Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1976 as four Kingston-based Schools of Visual Arts, Music, Dance and Drama, that were brought together in 1976 under the aegis of the Cultural Training Centre. Identified by UNESCO as pivotal institutions in the Caribbean 1979. Designated as the Inter-American Centre for Caribbean Cultural Development by the Organization of American State (OAS) 1983. Acquired current title following consolidation of the four schools
Founded 2006, formerly known as NCB Staff Training Centre
Founded 1907. Known as West Indies College before it acquired present status and title 1999

Divisions.College: Natural and Applied Sciences, Allied Health and Nursing

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1958 as Jamaica Institute of Technology, renamed College of Arts, Science and Technology (CAST) 1959, acquired present status and title 1995
AdmissionRequirements: 5 CXC (Caribbean Examination Council) subjects including Mathematics and English Language

Divisions.College: Joint Colleges of Medicine, Oral Health and Veterinary Sciences

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2002 as as University College of the Caribbean (UCC) through merger of the Institute of Management Sciences (IMS), founded 1992 and the Institute of Management and Production (IMP), founded 1976. Acquired current status and title 2017

Bachelor'sDegree: Electrical and Electronic Equipment and Maintenance
